result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:53 AM Defendant Juan F Flores appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Juan F Flores.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has pending cases in Milwaukee County expected to go to trial in October.
Defense requests a further proceedings date to allow the Milwaukee cases to resolve.
If defendant is in custody at the time of the next hearing he may appear by Zoom. If he is not in custody he is to appear in person for the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
10:25 AM Defendant Juan F Flores in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Juan F Flores.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. City of Waukesha Police Department Officer Benjamin Stern sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Tempelis. Cross examination by Attorney Rypel. Redirect by Attorney Tempelis. State rests. State moves for bind over with argument. Attorney Rypel objects to bind over with argument and moves to dismiss. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. Defendant can be returned forthwith to Milwaukee House of Corrections and will appear by Zoom at the next date.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.
filed, to be produced from Milwaukee House of Corrections

02:58 PM Defendant Juan F Flores appeared by Zoom, in custody, from Milwaukee House of Corrections with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Milwaukee House of Corrections.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Amended Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on May 9, 2022.
Hearing on June 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing July 1, 2022.

10:25 AM Defendant Juan F Flores in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Miller appears as friend of the court.  Attorney Miller notes she followed up with the Public Defender's Office prior to the case being called and the defendant remains ineligible for Public Defender Representation.  Attorney Miller is asking for the defendant to be provided with a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  Instead of the defendant filling out the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel, the Court goes over the defendant's finances on the record.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing July 1, 2022.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Time limits were previously waived.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant can be returned forthwith to Milwaukee House of Corrections and will appear by Zoom from Milwaukee HOC at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
